content.html:
Warm Up Activity

Figure A is a large square. Figure B is a large square with a smaller square removed. Figure C is composed of two large squares with one smaller square added.

Figure A

Figure B

Figure C

Write an expression to represent the area of each shaded figure when the side length of the large square is as shown in the first column.

Copy and complete the table. Compare your work by answering questions 1-12.

Side length of
large square

Area of A

Area of B

Area of C

\(4\)

\(x\)

\(4x\)

\(x+3\)


  1. When the side length of the large square is \(4\), what is the area of figure A?

Write down your answer, then select the solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

\(4^2\) (or an equivalent expression)



  1. When the side length of the large square is \(4\), what is the area of figure B?

Write down your answer, then select the solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

\(4^2-1\) (or an equivalent expression)



  1. When the side length of the large square is \(4\), what is the area of figure C?

Write down your answer, then select the solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

\(2(4^2)+1\) (or an equivalent expression)



  1. When the side length of the large square is \(x\), what is the area of figure A?

Write down your answer, then select the solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

\(x^2\) (or an equivalent expression)



  1. When the side length of the large square is \(x\), what is the area of figure B?

Write down your answer, then select the solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

\(x^2-1\) (or an equivalent expression)



  1. When the side length of the large square is \(x\), what is the area of figure C?

Write down your answer, then select the solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

\(2x^2+1\) (or an equivalent expression)



  1. When the side length of the large square is \(4x\), what is the area of figure A?

Write down your answer, then select the solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

\(16x^2\) or \((4x)^2\) (or an equivalent expression)



  1. When the side length of the large square is \(4x\), what is the area of figure B?

Write down your answer, then select the solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

\(16x^2-1\) (or an equivalent expression)



  1. When the side length of the large square is \(4x\), what is the area of figure C?

Write down your answer, then select the solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

\(32x^2+1\) (or an equivalent expression)



  1. When the side length of the large square is \(x+3\), what is the area of figure A?

Write down your answer, then select the solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

\((x+3)^2\) or \((x+3)(x+3)\) (or an equivalent expression)



  1. When the side length of the large square is \(x+3\), what is the area of figure B?

Write down your answer, then select the solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

\((x+3)^2-1\) (or an equivalent expression)



  1. When the side length of the large square is \(x+3\), what is the area of figure C

Write down your answer, then select the solution button to compare your work.

Compare your answer:

\(2(x+3)^2+1\) (or an equivalent expression)
